Package ui.input.selection

Class SelectableGrid<T extends V,​U extends SectionComposer<V>,​V extends SelectableSection>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.drawing.DrawableSection
      • ui.input.selection.DrawableSelectableSection
        • ui.input.selection.SelectableGrid<T,​U,​V>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of selectable section stored in the underlying section grid.
    U - The type of underlying section composer used by the underlying section grid.
    V - The type of section stored in the underlying section composer. (Unfortunately due to java limitations this has to extend selectable section).
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrintHandler, Section, SelectableSection, SelectionHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Game, GameBoard, Hand, SelectableBufferedGrid
    public class SelectableGrid<T extends V,​U extends SectionComposer<V>,​V extends SelectableSection>
extends DrawableSelectableSection
implements SelectableSection
    A selectable grid of sections built upon a SectionGrid. Sections can be moved between using the movement keys.
    Represents a selectable section that can be drawn to the terminal window.
    Represents a section that can be drawn to the terminal window.

      • SelectableGrid

        public SelectableGrid​(SectionGrid<T,​U,​V> grid,
                      TerminalHandler terminalHandler,
                      EscapeHandler escapeHandler,
                      boolean enabled)
        Constructor for SelectableGrid.
        Parameters:
        grid - The underlying SectionGrid to use.
        terminalHandler - The TerminalHandler object.
        escapeHandler - The escape handler to use when escape is pressed.
        enabled - Boolean; true if section is enabled for selection.

    • Method Detail

      • refocus

        private KeyHandler refocus​(KeyHandler current,
                           KeyHandler returned)
        Checks if two key handlers are equal and if so refocuses the current selection. This would be different if the parent to the selectable grid took control of input.
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        returned - The KeyHandler returned by the parent selection handler.
        Returns:
        Either the parent's KeyHandler or the refocused KeyHandler.

      • getClosest

        private java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Integer,​T> getClosest​(int selectedRow)
        Gets the closest enabled section in the specified row. Repeatedly finds higher and lower element from specified point until one is enabled or null is returned.
        Parameters:
        selectedRow - The row to check.
        Returns:
        The closest section or null if none available.

      • getHigher

        private java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Integer,​T> getHigher​(int selectedRow,
                                                                 int selectedCol)
        Gets the next item in the selected row that is enabled or null if none are available.
        Parameters:
        selectedRow - The row to check.
        selectedCol - The column to check from.
        Returns:
        The first available section or null if none available.

      • getLower

        private java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Integer,​T> getLower​(int selectedRow,
                                                                int selectedCol)
        Gets the previous item in the selected row that is enabled or null if none are available.
        Parameters:
        selectedRow - The row to check.
        selectedCol - The column to check from.
        Returns:
        The first available section or null if none available.

      • primaryNext

        public KeyHandler primaryNext​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when the user signals to move forward in the primary direction. In this case unfocuses and calls the parent's primaryNext method. If there's no parent return the current key handler (i.e. do nothing). In this case check each row above the currently selected one and if an available piece is found select it. If none are found pass the next call up to the parent selection handler.
        Specified by:
        primaryNext in interface SelectionHandler
        Overrides:
        primaryNext in class DrawableSelectableSection
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (could be the next element in the direction, or next option in the direction, etc).

      • primaryPrevious

        public KeyHandler primaryPrevious​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when the user signals to move backwards in the primary direction. In this case unfocuses and calls the parent's primaryPrevious method. If there's no parent return the current key handler (i.e. do nothing). In this case check each row below the currently selected one and if an available piece is found select it. If none are found pass the previous call up to the parent selection handler.
        Specified by:
        primaryPrevious in interface SelectionHandler
        Overrides:
        primaryPrevious in class DrawableSelectableSection
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (could be the next element in the direction, or next option in the direction, etc).

      • secondaryNext

        public KeyHandler secondaryNext​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when the user signals to move forwards in the secondary direction. In this case unfocuses and calls the parent's secondaryNext method. If there's no parent return the current key handler (i.e. do nothing). In this case check each row to the right of the currently selected one and if an available piece is found select it. If none are found pass the next call up to the parent selection handler.
        Specified by:
        secondaryNext in interface SelectionHandler
        Overrides:
        secondaryNext in class DrawableSelectableSection
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (could be the next element in the direction, or next option in the direction, etc).

      • secondaryPrevious

        public KeyHandler secondaryPrevious​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when the user signals to move backwards in the secondary direction. In this case unfocuses and calls the parent's secondaryPrevious method. If there's no parent return the current key handler (i.e. do nothing). In this case check each row to the left of the currently selected one and if an available piece is found select it. If none are found pass the previous call up to the parent selection handler.
        Specified by:
        secondaryPrevious in interface SelectionHandler
        Overrides:
        secondaryPrevious in class DrawableSelectableSection
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (could be the next element in the direction, or next option in the direction, etc).

      • unfocus

        protected void unfocus()
        Called whenever focus is lost (i.e. from moving to next selection).
        Specified by:
        unfocus in class DrawableSelectableSection

      • select

        public KeyHandler select​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when the user selects this element.
        Specified by:
        select in interface SelectionHandler
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (could be a different key handler for e.g. entering text).

      • focus

        public KeyHandler focus​(KeyHandler current)
        Called when this element is focused. If no handler is defined or section is not enabled call parent's focus method. If no parent is defined return current key handler. In this case try to get the currently selected section. If it's not available then recheck all the sections and find the closest that is.
        Specified by:
        focus in interface SelectionHandler
        Overrides:
        focus in class DrawableSelectableSection
        Parameters:
        current - The current KeyHandler.
        Returns:
        The KeyHandler to return (normally this element's movement selection handler).

      • getRow

        public void getRow​(ColouredStringBuilder builder,
                   int row,
                   int startCol,
                   int maxCols)
        Generates a single line of the section to be written to the terminal.
        Specified by:
        getRow in interface Section
        Parameters:
        builder - ColouredStringBuilder to handle ANSI colour coding in the most efficient manner.
        row - Which row of the section to generate.
        startCol - The column of the section to start at.
        maxCols - The max number of columns to draw.

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Getter for number of rows. In this case pass through to underlying section grid.
        Specified by:
        getRows in interface Section
        Returns:
        The height of the section in characters.

      • getColumns

        public int getColumns()
        Getter for number of columns. In this case pass through to underlying section grid.
        Specified by:
        getColumns in interface Section
        Returns:
        The width of the section in characters.

      • update

        public void update()
        Called before drawing the section. In this case pass through to underlying section grid.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Section
        Overrides:
        update in class DrawableSection

      • checkEnabled

        public void checkEnabled()
        Checks each section in the grid to make sure at least one is enabled. Calls the checkEnabled method of any contained SelectableGrids. If the currently selected section is no longer enabled find the closest one and enable that instead.

      • recheckSections

        public void recheckSections()
        Recreates the underlying data structure used to find selections. This is a list of maps of column to section. The selected row refers to the index in the list.

      • getSections

        protected T[][] getSections()
        Returns the underlying section grid as an array of sections.
        Returns:
        The array of sections.

      • getGrid

        protected SectionGrid<T,​U,​V> getGrid()
        Returns the underlying section grid.
        Returns:
        The section grid.

      • setEscapeHandler

        public void setEscapeHandler​(EscapeHandler escapeHandler)
        Setter for the escape handler.
        Parameters:
        escapeHandler - The new EscapeHandler.
